name: Acidity (Acid Reflux)
description: Acidity, also known as acid reflux, occurs when stomach acid flows back into the food pipe, causing burning sensation in the chest or throat. It is often triggered by spicy food, overeating, or lying down after meals.

mild.definition: Occasional mild burning without danger signs

high_risk.definition: Severe acidity or symptoms suggesting complications

criteria.other_symptoms: black stools, blood in vomit, severe stomach pain

self_care: Avoid spicy, oily, and acidic foods
Eat smaller meals at regular intervals
Do not lie down immediately after eating

medicines.name: Omeprazole 20mg Capsule
medicines.dose: Adults: 20 mg once daily before meals

medicines.name: Pantoprazole 40mg Tablet
medicines.used_for: Treatment of acid reflux and heartburn
medicines.dose: Adults: 40 mg once daily before breakfast

urgent: daily symptoms for more than 2 weeks
doctor_consultation.message: Seek medical attention if acidity is severe, persistent, or associated with black stools, blood in vomit, or severe abdominal pain.

assessment_questions.question: How severe is the burning sensation?
How often do you experience this?

disclaimer: This is educational information only and not a substitute for professional medical advice. Seek medical care for severe, persistent, or worsening symptoms.
